name: The Inn at Camden Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a long weekend this summer and absolutely loved it. It was right in town, so everything was walking distance. The rooms are very large and clean. Very comfortable bed. Loved having access to the coffee maker downstairs and access to the fridge to store items as well. If you are looking for a quiet & convenient place right in Camden, with very clean and spacious rooms, this is it!
reviews.title: Great Location, Right In Town, Big Clean Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are seasoned travelers as 60+ year old couple, but our first visit to Maine. This inn is the absolute best value in terms of price, location, and room features of any place in Camden Maine. Found great restaurant two blocks away at Bayview Lobster Restaurant with prices ranging from $10 to 25 for great seafood selections. We had haddock basket and corn chowder soup that was one our best meals in 3 days with great view of harbor and wonderful service. Camden is a far better place to experience the charm of Maine than Bar Harbor, which was jammed with thousands of tourists coming off two massive cruise ships on a Thursday filling the sidewalks and retail stores. Avoid any days the ships are in. Maine is one of the most friendly vacation regions we ever experienced with the most to do. Very much like North Carolina mountain and coastal regions where we live.
reviews.title: Best Inn Value and Location in Camden

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This inn does not feel like a hotel or a bed and breakfast rather the experience is much like spending the night in the home of a good friend. Staying here is a lovely experience.
reviews.title: Home Away From Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We plannned to spend two nights here and then travel on up the Maine coast. After traveling further north (downeast), we returned for our last two nights at the Inn because we enjoyed both the Inn and the Camden/Rockport area so much.
reviews.title: Best deal in town!

reviews.text: Our room cost a third of some nearby inns. With the "extra" money we took at schooner ride and had lobster for dinner! We were greeted well, and given some great tips for dining and sightseeing. We were steps from the main drag!
reviews.title: One Inn, many conveniences

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had not pre-booked this hotel/B&B and after checking out other accommodation in Camden we discovered this gem! This is a value for money hotel with spacious, clean and well appointed room and bathroom, complimentary wine for guests in the lounge each evening and inclusive continental breakfast at the bagel restaurant next door. The hotel is centrally located and was once the Brewster shirt factory! It has been fully renovated and it is hard to believe its former life. The hotel sits above the river which once drove the waterwheel to power the machines in the Brewster factory. The sound of the gushing river adds to the restful ambiance of the hotel. The staff were helpful and friendly. It is a short walk to a number of very nice restaurants in Camden.
reviews.title: Discover this gem in Camden!

likes.liked: — Spacious quality appointmentsand value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked our room at The Inn after looking all around for lodging during the Maine Lobster Fest with no luck. Upon arrival we were given a very warm welcome. Our room was very large and the entire place was spotless! The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable about the area. This was our last stop after staying in other areas on the Midcoast. Our stay there was the highlight of our trip! Wish we were still there!
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.text: We stopped one night in Camden and walked into the Inn at Camden Place and we were pleasantly surprised, although the room we stayed in was on the third level (no elevator) so hauling our luggage was a minor chore. The room was fairly large, exceptionally clean and new-seeming furnishings were very nice, with two very comfortable easy chairs facing the TV in a sitting area partitioned off from the bed. The pictures on the Expedia site (although not our room) are accurate to the style, roominess and comfort of the Inn. There are nice large lounge areas with free coffee and wine available, as well as a free breakfast in the adjacent bagel shop. Easy to walk to anywhere in downtown Camden.
reviews.title: Immaculate and upscale, but oh those stairs!

reviews.text: This is one of those rare hotels where, the moment you go through the door, you just know you’ve made the right choice. Despite arriving without a reservation, we were warmly greeted by the owner (I assume she was the owner; if she was an employee, she’s certainly worth every penny of her salary). She immediately introduced us to the bar area in the communal lounge, where we were able to help ourselves to a complementary supply of cold drinks. She also went out of her way to get some hot water so that I could fix myself a cup of tea. After a hot, tiring journey, this is the sort of welcome that a traveler really appreciates.
reviews.title: Delightful hotel, great location, exemplary service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights here when we want to Lobsterfest in Rockland, Maine. The inn-keepers were lovely. The room was pristine. The building does not have an elevator and we were on the third floor but the inn-keeper cheerfully hauled out bags up the stairs. Our standard room was large and comfortable and had a separate sitting area. The bathroom was standard. Outside our room was a large comfortable lounge. This would be a great place for a family where you have to put a child to bed and need a place to read while they are sleeping. The first floor lobby was also inviting. There is a refrigerator which is shared by the guests and complimentary wine. The location, while not central is within walking distance of everything in Camden. It is about two blocks from the ocean. Breakfast was included and was a disappointment; you are given a voucher for breakfast in a bagel place.
reviews.title: A great place to relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was really a pleasant surprise. A beautiful room, an extremely helpful person at the desk and parking within feet of the entrance. Walk to everything in Camden. Will go Back.
reviews.title: Convenient and very comfortable

reviews.text: Our room was huge and very comfortable, clean and well appointed. One of the few B&B's that had a room with two queens that could accommodate three adults. The Innkeepers were very nice and helpful. Wine was provided in the sitting area at no charge. Our breakfast in the next door Bagel place was very good and convenient. The location was one block off the main street and you could walk anywhere from the Inn ... even a few miles down the road to Camden State Park if you like to walk/hike.
reviews.title: Quiet with great location. Innkeepers were very helpful/nice. Very large comfortable room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything you've read about this hotel is true. It is a wonderful place- it has all the character and charm of a B&B with the professionalism and quality of a hotel. Everything about this place is perfect- location, service, cleanliness, decor, comfort, parking, you name it. For those not familiar with the are Camden is a quaint town on it's own but it is also just a short drive to Rockland (if you're coming for the Maine Lobster Festival).
reviews.title: Wonderful Getaway Hotel

reviews.text: Camden, Maine, is a protected harbor with deep water, sufficient to have allowed sailing ships in past times to anchor safely, bringing the wool to the mills here which were fed by the running streams. Now, at the head of this harbor, over a previous mill race, lies The Inn at Camden Place, a small delightfully comfortable inn. The Inn is airy, clean and done in a white/beige theme that emphasizes the open theme, very refreshing. The rooms are large, either with queen or king beds. The room we (3 total) stayed in had two queens and was quite large, more like a suite. Breakfast is supplied at a nearby bagel shop, a wide range of food for breakfast, not simply bagels. The main room, in which the front desk resides, offers a red or white wine available to guests 24/7, along with the usual coffee. Camden is an active tourist town, full of shops and restaurants, with a harbor full of diverse types of boats, many of which (quite possibly all...) are for rent for tours, 2 hours at the time or for days, you choose. This is a wonderful seaside town, not too far from the Acadia national park. The Inn at Camden Place is lush, comfortable and makes one feel like a million dollars. Bottom line: stay here when in Camden, one cannot do any better.
reviews.title: Wonderfully comfy

likes.liked: — Clean, roomy, efficient, center of town, absolutely comfortable

reviews.text: My husband and I recently traveled with other family members to Maine for my first visit. I checked online for places to stay and found great reviews for the Inn at Camden Place. We were all extremely happy with our very large, spacious rooms and the Innkeeper could not have been more accommadat.ing to make our stay so pleasant. We thoroughly enjoyed our breakfast of delicious bagel sandwiches and coffee at The Bagel Cafe which was right out the front door and up the steps. It was a cozy atmosphere with very friendly people. We would definately stay at the Inn at Camden Place on our next visit to Camden/Rockport, Maine.
reviews.title: Spectacularly comfortable rooms-delightful Innkeepers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We researched where to stay for our two nights in Camden and were glad we decided on the Inn...it felt like we had our own luxury one room apt in downtown Camden; booked a king room which was very spacious and luxurious. Bed was exceptionally comfy. Babling brook (really the river) flowed just outside our room complete with white (and one black) swan. a few steps from Main street and shops. Kathleen and JP at front desk were exceptional. Complementary breakfast coupons at Bagel Cafe nextdoor a nice touch. Everything we wanted and more. Appreciated the privacy we don't find at fancy B&B's (or larger hotels)....recommend highly!
reviews.title: Our home away from home at Inn at Camden Place

reviews.text: I was traveling with a girl friend who I hadn't seen in years and admittedly wanted everything to be good. It has been two weeks and she is still commenting on what a nice stay we had at this Inn. I had never stayed here but I also was impressed with the nice and helpful staff and comfortable room. I loved the free 24-hour coffee and tea and there were a selection of movies and reading material available from the lobby. It was a wonderful, restful, accomodation with staff who were fun and helpful.
reviews.title: outstanding service in a picturesque location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best thing about the Inn, is that it is next to the police station.
reviews.title: Centrally located, but you can do better for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived we were greeted by a gentleman who stated the doors are locked at night I don't stay here. Forget about a concierge full time, his number is posted on the door in case of an emergency. The entry hallway carpets need a good cleaning, room was okay overlooked a parking lot, and we had to carry our luggage upstairs two flights to get there.
reviews.title: Hidden Jewel in Camden

aka: The Inn At Camden Place Maine
